sgraph

Interface IScenegraph

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Scenegraph

    public interface IScenegraph
    This interface captures all the operations that a scene graph should offer. It is designed to be a generic scene graph that is independent of the actual rendering library It achieves this by working with an IScenegraphRenderer interface The scene graph provides functions to store actual geometry (object instances) within itself so that they can be shared within many leaves. Each node of the scene graph keeps a reference to it, enabling any node of the scene graph to directly call its functions. Conversely the scene graph also stores references to all the nodes keyed by their name. This way the scene graph can directly refer to any of its nodes by name instead of traversing the tree every time to find it. This is useful when nodes must be identified and animated in specific ways.
    Author:
    Amit Shesh

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNode(java.lang.String name, INode node)
      Adds a node to itself.
      void addPolygonMesh(java.lang.String name, PolygonMesh obj)
      Add a polygon mesh that will be used by one or more leaves in this scene graph
      void animate(float time)
      Specific scene graph implementations should put code that animates specific nodes in the scene graph, based on a time provided by the caller
      void draw(java.util.Stack<org.joml.Matrix4f> modelView)
      Draw this scene graph, using the stack of modelview matrices provided.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,PolygonMesh> getPolygonMeshes()
      Get a mapping of all (name,mesh) pairs that have been added to this scene graph This function is useful in case all meshes of one scene graph have to be added to another in an attempt to merge two scene graphs
      INode getRoot()
      Get the root of this scene graph

      initialize the supplied root to the be the root of this scene graph.

      Set the renderer to this scene graph.

    • Method Detail

      • setRenderer

        void setRenderer(IScenegraphRenderer renderer)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the renderer to this scene graph. All specific rendering commands are delegated to this renderer, making the scene graph independent of the rendering implementation
        Parameters:
        renderer - The IScenegraphRenderer object that will act as its renderer
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - this is not specific. It exists for future renderers to communicate any exceptions to the scene graph

      • makeScenegraph

        void makeScenegraph(INode root)
        initialize the supplied root to the be the root of this scene graph. This is supposed to overwrite any previous roots
        Parameters:
        root -

      • draw

        void draw(java.util.Stack<org.joml.Matrix4f> modelView)
        Draw this scene graph, using the stack of modelview matrices provided. The scene graph will use this stack as it navigates its tree.
        Parameters:
        modelView -

      • addPolygonMesh

        void addPolygonMesh(java.lang.String name,
                  PolygonMesh obj)
        Add a polygon mesh that will be used by one or more leaves in this scene graph
        Parameters:
        name - a unique name by which this mesh may be referred to in future
        obj - the PolygonMesh object

      • animate

        void animate(float time)
        Specific scene graph implementations should put code that animates specific nodes in the scene graph, based on a time provided by the caller
        Parameters:
        time - provides a simple time reference for animation

      • addNode

        void addNode(java.lang.String name,
           INode node)
        Adds a node to itself. This should be stored in a suitable manner by an implementation, so that it is possible to look up a specific node by name
        Parameters:
        name - (hopefully unique) name given to this node
        node - the node object

      • getRoot

        INode getRoot()
        Get the root of this scene graph
        Returns:
        the root of this scene graph

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,PolygonMesh> getPolygonMeshes()
        Get a mapping of all (name,mesh) pairs that have been added to this scene graph This function is useful in case all meshes of one scene graph have to be added to another in an attempt to merge two scene graphs
        Returns:
